instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01958: What is 820-01958? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A2179: What is A2179? A2179 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2020 with EMC 3302, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01958..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_G3S: What is PP5V_G3S? PP5V_G3S is a 5v power rail present when the system is in a G3S standby state.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.3V3_G3H: What is 3V3_G3H? This is one of the first power rails that must turn on for Macbooks that use USB-C for charging. This power rail powers the CD3215 chip that controls the USB-C charger, speaks to the USB-C charger, and requests 20 volts up from the default 5 volts that the USB-C charger puts out when initially connected to an unknown device. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MacBook Air. Board number is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. There was a little sticky substance and corrosion on <CAPACITOR>C7670</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C7665</CAPACITOR>. Board will take anywhere between 25 and 100 milliamps and then it will cycle, but the cycles are not consistent.  <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 12.29 V with battery plugged in and without battery. Have tried restoring with Apple Configurator 2, but I get stuck with Error 4005. <SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL> is missing, where the corrosion occurred. Pin 12 which is the enable pin of <CHIP>U7650</CHIP> appears to come from <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> and is also missing. Not sure where to go from here.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
DFU process should go on if all AWAKE and SLPS2R voltageas are steady.
Also check if SSD voltages are there, at least when trying DFU revive.

Incorrect <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage denotes bad communication between T2 and <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
DFU can solve this, if is the result of T2 firmware corruption.

<SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> (L7690) comes on?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: I haven't measured AWAKE and SLPS2R or SSD yet, but I started with the easiest thing and measured <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> at Pin 1 of L7690. I get 3.29 Volts and then itll drop to 3.23, 3.0, 2.68, 1.63, then cycle back up to 3.29. (I think this is what pulsing means?) Will update with other voltages.
